title: Scratchwood and Moat Mount Open Space Walking Route

images.title: Dudley Miles / Public domain
images.caption: Leg of Mutton Pond, Moat Mount Nature Reserve, Mill Hill, Barnet

images.title: Robert Timms / Moat Mount Lake
images.caption: Moat Mount Lake. This quiet lake is situated in the centre of Moat Mount. It has a variety of wildlife and a vast range of trees.

images.title: Robert Timms / Moat Mount tree lined walk.
images.caption: Moat Mount tree lined walk. This paved tree lined walk, goes from the car park steeply up hill to the lake at the top.

images.title: Robert Timms / Moat Mount tree markers
images.caption: Moat Mount tree markers. This view around the back of the lake, shows one of dozens of tree identification markers placed all around the country park.The park has a vast amount of tree species.

images.title: Bluebells in Barnet Gate Wood by David Howard, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Bluebells in Barnet Gate Wood in April.

images.title: Small pond by Dollis Brook by N Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Towards Gravel Pit Wood by Des Blenkinsopp, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Towards Gravel Pit Wood in autumn

images.title: Dollis Valley Greenwalk by Des Blenkinsopp, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Dollis Valley Greenwalk through the park

description: These two parks are situated right next to each other in the London Borough of Barnet . There are some nice footpaths linking the two parks with woodland trails, ponds and lots of wildlife to look out for. You can start your walk from the Scratchwood car park just off the A1 Barnet Way. The London Loop long distance trail will take you through the park's woodland and on into Moat Mount just to the east. Here you'll find open grassland, wild flowers and great views over the city from the high points in the park. The Dollis Valley Green Walk passes through the park so you can continue along this trail to extend your walk. If you follow it east it will take you along the Dollis Brook through Barnet. You could also follow the London Loop west and visit the nearby Aldenham Country Park .
